text: When I was 16 my family drove up the coast of California while it lightly raining.  We had all the windows down and I was blasting this song through my headphones. We went into an underpass though a mountain and it was super dark. The lights in the underpass quickly went by in my peripheral vision and it was dark otherwise. As soon as we left the underpass the song hit 2:07 it was no longer raining. The air smelled so good and the sun shined into our car.It was so sunny that it was like a flash of light leaving the underpass. The ocean waves were hitting the shore so hard and the there were not other cars but us. It's hard to describe how heavenly it was. I don't think I'll ever feel that close to peace on earth again,but that was a wonderful memory.

text:
"A breathtaking sight. Imitations they may be, but together, they still make a fine spectacle. However, there are flowers of an evil blossom, and abominations are fated to perish." (After summoning Goemon)
"I must admit, I learned much from you, Madarame. To see authenticity, one must be dispassionately realistic.
I see your true self without reservations, with Goemon by my side!"
"I should be thanking you. Any reason I may have had to forgive you has now vanished without a trace. Now, I understand what you truly are. You're not simply an untalented artist, you're a monster who wears the skin of one." (Before fighting Madarame)
author: YusukeYusuke matt_mercer

text:
"A breathtaking sight... Imitations they may be, but together, they make a fine spectacle... Though the flowers of evil blossom, be it known... Abominations are fated to perish!" (After summoning Goemon)
"I learned much from you, Madarame. In order to see authenticity, one must be dispassionately realistic.
I can now ascertain your true self without any reservations, with Goemon by my side!"
"I thank you, Madarame... Every reason for me to forgive you has disappeared without a trace just now. You're not some rotten artist... You're a despicable fiend who wears the skin of an artist!" (Before fighting Madarame)
author: YusukeYusuke matt_mercer

text:
"This is my other self!" (Summoning Persona)
"I am thou!" (Summoning Persona)
"Let's go!" (Summoning Persona)
"Persona!" (Summoning Persona)
"Die!" (Persona casting skill)
"I'll end it!" (Persona casting skill)
"Goemon! / Kamu Susano-o! / Gorokichi!" (Exploiting enemy's weakness)
"Goemon, strike!" (Exploiting enemy's weakness)
"Crush them, Kamu Susano-o!" (Exploiting enemy's weakness)
"Wipe them out, Gorokichi!" (Exploiting enemy's weakness)
"Take this!" (Using offensive Skill)
"Can't stop shaking!" (Inflicted with fear)
"Gah...My eyes...!" (Inflicted with dizziness)
"I couldn't finish it." (Leaving the enemy alive)
"Stand still." (Initiating a Hold Up)
"Painful, isn't it?" (Initiating a Hold Up)
"Now! Let us strike!" (Initiating All-Out Attack)
"Everyone, with me!" (Initiating All-Out Attack)
"I will slice you to pieces!" (Initiating All-Out Attack)
"We've done it!" (All-Out Attack Finishing Touch)
"And the curtain falls." (All-Out Attack Finishing Touch)
"The finale!" (All-Out Attack Finishing Touch)
"Much thanks! / Thank you!" (When someone heals him)
"I'll use my own judgment." (Tactics changed to Act Freely)
"I will beat them soundly." (Tactics changed to Full Assault)
"I won't use my Persona." (Tactics changed to Conserve SP)
"Focusing on defense." (Tactics changed to Heal/Support)
"Give me your orders." (Tactics changed to Direct Command)
"All according to plan." (Battle results)
"Well, onto the next triumph." (Battle results)
"Easier than cleaning my brushes." (Battle results)
author: YusukeYusuke matt_mercer

text:
"Impurity of the heart will undoubtedly seep onto an artist's canvas eventually."
"I do not paint for the sake of others' comprehension."
"You are correct. Surrendering myself to fate after only one failure would be very much unlike me."
"I will start by painting. After that, I will paint, beyond which I shall paint even more. That is the only way I will learn to capture the essence of emotion. After all, you can only accomplish so much in using logic to analyze the contents of the heart."
author: YusukeYusuke matt_mercer

text: "That is why I am so upset with my own indecision. Such vague ambition is, in essence, a sin of sorts... Though I suppose allowing my young career to come to an end here would be even more sinful."

text: This song, every time I listen to it is a breath of fresh air. Really gets my wanderlust in overdrive and tickles my brain in the nicest way imaginable. As a famous Philosopher once said "Life without music would be a mistake." I wholeheartedly agree with that statement, for me since I've first heard this song, I love a lot of songs, too many if I'm being honest but this one is special it plays to that wonderful aspect of my being who never grew out of that childlike sense of wonder. I don't know how and I don't know why but Shawn Mendes and his music has always been near and dear to my heart and I'm forever grateful to live at the same time as this guy and hear all of the wonderful things he can make.

JESUS CHRIST = THE ONLY BEGOTTEN SON OF GOD, WHOM GOD GAVE AS SACRIFICE TO REDEEM THE WHOLE MANKIND: John 3:16 | View whole chapter | See verse in context For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life. text:
I wonder… 

Does anyone else fall asleep, and wake in another reality? 
The same one, I mean—it’s different.
It’s a half-painted world, 
like the half-read;
written—
books, 
half-written poems—
all of them, little puzzles—
of phrases, or songs, a window left open and me, 
clearly falling asleep— 
So I thought. 
Until, 
It wasn’t just phrases, 
It was words—
And it wasn’t just songs,
and It wasn’t the cicadas through my half-open window. It wasn’t the ocean,—
too far.
It was the keys of my piano. 
floating around my mind like scattered stars—and my mind too.
Divided, in every way I could imagine—
A spiraling fit of madness,
Yet the world—
this world of painted-halves—
It feels more finished when I dream.

I wonder…. 

When I dream, 
where do I go? 
Do I fall? 
Do We fall? 
Like stars—
across the sky, 
and to where? 
To whom?

Do we always—end up here? 
Where is here?—Who are we—Who am I?
All I know—that which I do not,
But, consistently and very persistently.

I transpire—a moon-flower, 
provided the regard of an ambivalent and ephemeral white of a bloom, 
nocturnal apropos the sun, 
primordially adjoining the reputed crepuscule we bare upon the night,
lying veiled betwixt the celerity of August and an ever-bewildering, yet paradoxically-convoluted October sky—

September.

I ended up here.
And, surrounded by all of my half-paintings.

Anyone else? I mean, what is that?

I wonder…

and I’m still in wonder.
author: Erin Lee Cronise

text: By no means am I a fan of Shawn Mendes, I'm just a casual listener. I heard this song on the radio a few months back and it really struck me. It captured me quickly and I found myself listening intently to the words he was saying rather than just treating this song as background music. I'm listening to this song again and finding more things to be impressed with, like his vocals! Added this to a few of my playlists and am looking forward to more of his music!!

text:
The Cinematography, Special Effects, and Practical Effects in this video are stellar! The Lighting is very well done and the camera angles are excellent. This video feels very fluid and cohesive, it all comes together very cleanly.

The lyrics in this song are very good, some parts feel kind of generic to me, like the "I wonder if you feel it too. I wonder what it's like to be loved by you." But that isn't because generic, but rather, it's a relatable situation to be in!

The sound production and instrumentals feel great and well handled, but I'm not a music expert so I couldn't honestly tell you!

Score:10/10
author: NeptunicDolphin

text: Wonder is one the best songs Shawn has ever written, it has powerful lyrics and such an epic sound. But the rest of the album wasn't that good, I mean it's not a bad album at all, but the rest of the songs aren't into a this "cinematic" style, it's just a lot of typical love songs. Anyway, I love Shawn and his personal and honest music
